name: Video Voyeur #1: "So Small" Quiz | Music | 10 Questions

questions.text: Is Carrie Underwood in her video, "So Small"?
questions.correct: yes, she's singing on the highway
options: no, all that is heard is her voice
yes, she plays the girl walking down the highway
yes, she plays the female driver
questions.explanation:
yes, she's singing on the highway.

	This is Carrie Underwood's fifth video. "So Small" is her first single on her second album "Carnival Ride". The video for "So Small" debuted the morning of September 20, 2007. In honor of Carrie's new video, CMT played the video back-to-back for six hours. It aired close to 200,000 times the first week it debuted. Carrie sings in the video, but does not act as a character.

questions.text: Was the teenage girl in "So Small" going to commit suicide?
questions.explanation:
Yes.

	The teenage girl had a fight with her mother and walked out the house. While on the road, she stepped out in front of a car on purpose which was driven by a female.

questions.text: Which star of "Angel" played the male character driving the second car?
questions.explanation:
Christian Kane.

	Christian Kane has acted in TV shows such as "Angel", "Close To Home" and "Rescue 77".

questions.text: How many children did the female driver have?
questions.explanation:
Three.

	The female driver was seen with three children and a husband. She was out driving after having a frustrating day by herself with three children.

questions.text: What color car was the male driver driving?
questions.explanation:
Red.

	The male character had left his house after having a fight with his wife or girlfriend. He was on the right side of the road when the teenage girl stepped out in front of the female driver's car.

questions.text: What happened after the two cars collided?
options: Carrie was seen sitting in the passenger seat of both cars
questions.explanation:
Time stopped.

	When the female driver saw the teenage girl standing in front of her, she swerved her blue car into the right hand lane and hit the male driver's car. Time stopped when the two cars collided, even though all the characters were still moving.

questions.text: When time stopped, what was Carrie surrounded by while singing?
questions.explanation:
Shattered glass.

	When time stopped, Carrie was surrounded by shattered glass from both vehicles while she sang. She grabbed one of the fragments of glass and let it fall into a puddle of water.

Yes.

	After the crash, time rewound itself to the point where the teenage girl walked out in front of the female driver's car. The female driver stopped in time and the male driver on the right hand side of the road stopped as well. All three stared at each other.

questions.text: What was the male driver doing when the accident occurred?
options: Searching for a CD in the floor
questions.explanation:
Talking on his cell phone.

	The male driver was having a heated argument on his cell phone when the female driver swerved her car into his lane to avoid the teenage girl.

questions.text: What happened to the teenage girl who ran away from home?
options: She kept walking down the road
Her mother pulled up to the accident and took her home
She was hit by another car
questions.explanation:
She went back home.

	The video ended with the male character returning home and sitting beside his wife or girlfriend on the steps, the female character returned home to see her children sleeping in their beds, and the teenage girl returned home and gave her mother a hug.
